Author: jl777c#5810
Content: good news! The problem I had was that I made 100 payment tx to create a bunch of vouts for the parallel dicefinish

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this made me find the bug that I wrongly assumed the vout for the entropy txid would always be 0, off by one in the vout/vin dereferencing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so to fix it, I needed to include the vout into the entropy calculation

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but that would be a hardforking change and I didnt want to do it two days in a row

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: one hardfork a day keeps the doctor away *scnr*

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: i'll show myself out :trollface:

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but, after analysing the code, I realized that only the dealer node actually calculates the entropy for the dealer entropy and that the players are posting their entropy in the opreturn, so they can change how they calculate it at anytime

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but there are 7000+ entropy tx using the old broken way to calculate the entropy

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: luckily the validation uses the proof of hash of entropy, ie. the entropy used in the dicefinish tx

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and the entropy tx includes the hash of entropy

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so, the dealer side can compare the entropy using the old way and if the hash of entropy matches, to use that. if not to use the new bug fixed method!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and i am seeing this work now that we had a bunch of bets go by

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so after a while the entropy collision will go away and the 51% secret reveal attack will be properly detected

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all this was a pretty good test of the 51% attack detection

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: tl:dr spam the bets as much as possible and try to break the chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: still have the dealer node optimization to make it go faster, but that wont affect any consensus, or actually any behavior as it would be an inplace change. which means we are down to just a few things left before we can consider KMDICE completed at the core level
